page.title: 010UR AREA, BONAR BRIDGE
page.content: {Bonar Bridge}is situated in the southern part of the district of {Sutherland}in the{Highland Region. It is on a hilly site reaching from sea level to a height of 160m. It is bordered to the south by the waters of the Kyle of Sutherland and the Dornoch Firth. The older part of the village lies near the waters' edge while newer houses have been built on the hill behind. The village peters out to scattered buildings and crofts reaching northwards. The scenery is beautiful encompassing lochs, rivers, hills, forests and moors. All are abundant in wildlife. The older houses of the village are stone-built and interesting while some of the new command fine views over the Kyle to the mountains beyond. The climate is kind, being drier than most parts of the North.
